fields.headline: More tempting winter getaways
fields.bodyText: Tunisia The capital, Tunis, is calmer in the winter months, and temperatures are in their teens. Near the Zitouna Mosque, the 12-room Dar El Medina Hotel (00 216 7156 3022; www.darelmedina.com features a terraced cafe, Moorish coffee shop and creamy interiors full of antique furniture. Doubles from £65 a night. Flights with Tunis Air (00 216 7083 7100; www.tunisair.com cost from £250 return from Heathrow. Oman For slouchy, luxury beachside lounging, the Chedi hotel (00 968 2452 4401; www.chedimuscat.com) in Muscat is ideal, offering a modern take on the romantic Middle Eastern look and rooms from £150 a night. Dark seductive infinity pools are surrounded by white towelling double day-beds, tiled terraces and palms are dotted through luscious gardens. Flights with Qatar Airways (0870 770 4215; www.qatarairways.com) from £350. Egypt With temperatures soaring to 45C in summer, winter is a much more pleasant time to explore the wonderful sights of Egypt, with temperatures in the low 20s. A few days are enough to see Cairo and the surrounding attractions. The Pyramids, Sphinx, Egyptian Museum and a Nile dinner cruise are included in a four-night break with the Classic Traveller (01293 422440; www.theclassictraveller.co.uk), which costs £639 pp, including accommodation at the magnificent Mena House Hotel, which is next to the Pyramids. South Africa Flying for 11 hours to reach the other side of the equator for a weekend break may seem like madness, but three days is just about long enough to get to grips with Cape Town. With only two hours time difference and no jetlag, you can get straight out to the funky Camps Bay beach area, to the top of Table Mountain and along the rocky coast of Cape Point. Rainbow Tours (020 7226 1004; www.rainbowtours.co.uk) can organise a three-night break for £925pp, staying in the elegant Winchester Mansions hotel. Libya Fill a long weekend with magical exploration in Libya. The ancient Roman cities of Sabratha, Oea and Leptis Magna are included in a four-night tour of the 2,000km Mediterranean coast. It should still be warm enough for a swim, and it only takes 3.5 hours to get there. Explore (0870 333 4001; www.explore.co.uk) runs short breaks until March, from £625 pp, including flights from Gatwick.
